metadata.title: CVE-2021-20299 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - negligible
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in OpenEXR's Multipart input file functionality. A craftedmulti-part input file with no actual parts can trigger a NULL pointerdereference. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to systemavailability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20299` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenexr-3-1-30 - 2.5.7-1
openexr - 2.5.7-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openexr package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.5.7-1').
